name: Mixed Bag 25 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Abe Beame was mayor of what city?
questions.explanation:
New York.

	He was the first Jewish mayor of New York and died at the age of 94. He was mayor from 1974 to 1977.

questions.text: Harley Street in London is associated with what business?
questions.explanation:
Medicine.

	It is the single greatest concentration of medical expertise anywhere in the world.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a title of courtesy?
questions.explanation:
Bachelor.

	A bachelor is an unmarried person by definition.

questions.text: Which of the following is the name of a flower?
questions.explanation:
Sweet William.

	It is a flower native to Europe. It is red, pink, purple or violet in color and has a vase life of 7-10 days.

questions.text: What state was the site of 'The Waltons'?
questions.explanation:
Virginia.

	It was on TV from September 1972 to August 1981. It was a popular show with no sex or violence.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a title of rank?
questions.explanation:
Amigo.

	An amigo means friend or comrade.

questions.text: Who was the star of the TV show 'Hennesey'?
questions.explanation:
Jackie Cooper.

	This show co-starred Abby Dalton and was about a young naval medical officer stationed in San Diego.

questions.text: The title 'sir' indicates which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Knighthood.

	The orders helped establish the concept of the knight as an honorable and pious Christian soldier.

questions.text: What two countries aided Franco in the Spanish Civil War?
questions.explanation:
Germany and Italy.

	The war lasted from 1936-1939. Both Hitler and Mussolini sent planes to aid Franco.

questions.text: Who was the star of TV's 'The Deputy'?
questions.explanation:
Henry Fonda.

	It was set in the Arizona Territory in the early 1880s and ran from September 1959 to September 1961.
